entry.title: GRC, Trade and Tax with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With this blog I will walk you through the selected key highlights for Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC), Trade and Tax in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508:

In case you do not need all the information and just briefly want to get an overview of the release highlights, please watch the video below:

 
Video #1: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 GRC

This blog covers the following innovations:

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

  • Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)
  • Overview pages for controls
  • Overview pages for risks

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

  • Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling
  • Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network
  • India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B
  • Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

SAP International Trade Management

  • Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)
  • Localization option for Intrastat (BDT)
  • New compliance status for purchase orders
  • Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes
  • Audit trail for Watch List Screening

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)

Fig #1 : preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions

SAP Risk and Assurance Management comes with predefined business content that you can use of the box, such as predefined automated procedures and controls, to minimize the effort of building your financial compliance management framework.

Value Proposition

  • Speed up usage with predefined business content for detection rules
  • Enable finance departments to detect fraud or suspicious payments

Capabilities

  • New automated procedures with a focus on anti-money laundering and fraud:
    • High-risk country incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against list of countries or regions deemed to be high-risk
    • Payer name deviation in incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against transferring vendor name.
    • Postings on expense accounts
    • Outgoing payments on expense accounts
    • IBAN deviations in incoming payments
    • Customer negative amount postings by user
    • Customer negative amount postings by ratio

For more information, see: Business Content for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Overview pages for controls

 

Video #2: Demo Overview Page

This Overview page is designed to help our Compliance Managers save time by effectively monitoring progress & getting an instant overview that no critical control runs are missed and helping him quickly identifying and analyzing errors in work packages.

Value Proposition

  • Centralised information hub
  • Improved decision making through real time monitoring
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive operations

Capabilities

  • Operational dashboard for the compliance manager to get an overview of controls and work packages of the organisation
  • Overview on control performance results in time intervals, by control risk level and significance and  work packages by procedure run status
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Controls Analytics

Overview pages for risk management

Fig #2 : overview pages for risk management

A risk heat map is an important tool for a risk manager helping them identify, prioritize, and address risks, as well as communicate about risks with stakeholders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain real-time risk visibility
  • Improve the efficiency of the risk manager
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive risk management

Capabilities

  • Visualised dashboard that helps risk managers gain insights into the overall risk status of the organization
  • Heatmaps showing the current risk landscape
  • View risks by different dimensions, such as organization unit, risk category, and so on
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Risk Overview

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

 

Video #3:  Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

Schedule Mass Action enables you to automate the generation of multiple report runs simultaneously and set them to recur at desired intervals. This feature is beneficial for streamlining reporting processes, saving time, and ensuring consistency in report generation.

Mass Action now also supports trigger of workflow approvals and submission of report runs electronically.

The Update Reporting Tasks feature allows you to instantly update specific reporting tasks for a desired reporting year through the reports dashboard.

A new submission status has now been introduced for the processing of runs with large volumes of documents. When a run involves more than 100 documents, the status will now display as Submission In Progress.

Benefits

  • Automate the approval and submission process, improving overall efficiency
  • Automate and schedule report generation, helping ensure consistency, improving efficiency, and reducing errors
  • Provide flexible options for defining report generation schedules
  • Improve efficiency and consistency in statutory reporting by streamlining the application of common properties across multiple reports
  • Introduce a separate option to create or update reporting tasks, providing users with the flexibility to create or update reporting tasks as and when desired, rather than wait for the technical job to run

For more information please refer to :

  • Help Document: Trigger Mass Action
  • Define Statutory Reports
  • Help Document: Electronic Submission of Reports
  • Help Document: Mass Action
  • Help Document: Schedule Mass Action
  • Help Document: Update Reporting Tasks
  • Run Statutory Reports

Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network

Fig #3: Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network Malaysia e-invoicing regulation:

  • When you sell goods or services to a customer, you should create and submit an electronic invoice to the Inland Revenue Board of Malaysia (IRBM) first for clearance. Once the IRBM clears the electronic invoice, you can then send it to the customer.
  • Once the electronic invoice is cleared, you can then send it to your business partner over the Peppol network with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • As of May 28, 2025, official accreditation of SAP as a service provider and Peppol-ready solution provider by the Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC).

Exchanging electronic documents (invoices, credit notes, debit notes) through the Peppol network is enabled.

More details: Sending Electronic Invoices to Customers Using Peppol

India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

Fig #4: India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

  • Monthly outward supplies return (GSTR-1):
    • Automated retrieval of auto-populated GSTR-1 from the goods and service tax network (GSTN) (in a draft return) and comparison against business transactions in the sales register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Review and finalization of the draft return, including the digital signature and filing
  • Inward purchase invoices and reconciliation:
    • Automatically retrieve GSTR-2A invoices from the GSTN portal and reconcile them against business transactions in the purchase register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Monthly consolidated tax return (GSTR-3B):
    • Automated retrieval of data from GSTN (manual input of 2B data), review, and manual adjustment with traceability and filing

More details: India GSTR reports

Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

Fig #5: Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

As countries rapidly adopt e-invoicing mandates, tax accountants face growing challenges in handling complex, technical errors from high-volume electronic document exchanges. Joule with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance enables tax accountants to quickly understand these errors via clear explanations in natural language, without digging into complex formats and technical descriptions. This results in faster processing, reduced penalties, and improved cash flow—saving both time and money.​

Value Proposition​

  • Easy to understand explanations to complex electronic document errors.​
  • Uncover error root causes faster with resolution recommendations.​
  • Boost productivity and drive better business results.​
  • Better user experience with native language support.​

Capabilities​

  • User can simply ask Joule for error explanation in natural language.​
  • Get easy to understand context aware explanations.​
  • Error explanation include root cause and recommended resolution steps​
  • User can explore details via relevant SAP Help Documentation links provided.​
  • User can leverage multi-language capabilities for better experience. ​

For more information, see: Help Document: Electronic Document Error Handling with SAP Joule

SAP International Trade Management

Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Fig #6: Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Three cloud BAdIs are provided to select additional documents and change detail data. 

  • INTRASTAT_GET_BILLING_DOCS: to select additional billing documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_GET_PURCHASE_DOCS: to select additional purchase documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_CHANGE_DATA: to change data in documents selected by selection reports (which are selected via both standard and BAdIs)

For more information, please check New BAdI for Intrastat: Get Additional Purchasing Documents

Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Fig #7: Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Customers that want to implement Intrastat for non-standard countries, must use the SAP Central Business Configuration tool to access the new configuration items.

Configuration item 1: Basic data for Intrastat

Configuration item 2: Default values for Intrastat

Configuration item 3: Data selection for Intrastat

For more information, please see New Configuration Items for Intrastat Non-Standard Countries

New compliance status for purchase orders

Fig #8: New compliance status for purchase orders

With this feature, a Trade Compliance specialist can check on dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain transparency on dedicated statuses of international trade compliance checks in purchase orders
  • Help ensure frictionless international trade processes

Capabilities 

  • Dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders
  • New status fields to be available on purchase order header and item level in the purchase order advanced app
  • New status fields substitute the compliance status by the on-hold status in the purchase order

For more information, see Dedicated Trade Compliance Statuses in Purchase Orders​ and Product Compliance in Purchase Orders

Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

 

Video #4: Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

Increase productivity and leverage already existing trade product classifications for your decisions with AI-assisted trade classification proposals with fuzzy search

  • Step 1: Enable generation classification proposals for each numbering scheme
  • Step 2: Schedule jobs for classification proposals
  • Step 3: Optimize generated trade classification proposals (optional)

For more information, see:  Product Classification Proposal

Audit trail for Watch List Screening

 

Video #5: Audit trail for Watch List Screening

With this app you can display an audit trail for your screening requests. The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

Value Proposition

  • Support audits by providing data

Capabilities 

  • The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

For more information, see: Display Audit Trail

entry.title: Minimizing SAP License Costs by optimizing SAP Authorizations with MOON Services
entry.content:
“MOON – Minimize Overhead, Optimize Need”

Efficient authorization management is crucial within the SAP environment for optimizing license costs. MOON Services aim to reduce authorizations to their necessary minimum, ensuring that what SAP users utilize is licensed, while optimizing unused authorizations. Let's explore the three essential MOON services: "MOON License Simulation", "MOON License Quickfix" and "MOON License Service powered by AIRC", each designed to enhance license management.

MOON License Simulation

MOON License Simulation focuses on precisely defining user license types in the SAP S/4HANA system through tailored authorizations to their essential minimum. This service enables companies to manage licenses efficiently and significantly reduce unnecessary costs.

Through simulation, customers can identify potential license cost optimizations when engaging in an authorization redesign with SAP Consulting. The service includes downloading usage data and calculating license costs for a new S/4HANA authorization concept against the requirements of the current STAR Service framework. Customers gain insight into possible license cost optimizations that can be achieved after an authorization redesign.


MOON License Quickfix

The MOON License Quickfix service offers rapid modifications to existing authorization structures, ensuring efficiency in license categorization. By analyzing current authorizations and making immediate role adjustments, companies can implement instant cost-saving measures.

This service focuses on reducing effort by minimizing authorization values and adapting authorization objects. By achieving quick wins in license type optimization, companies can significantly save costs while maintaining operational efficiency.


MOON License Service powered by AIRC

MOON License Service powered by AIRC (Automated Implementation of Role Concept) elevates license cost minimization to a new level, employing advanced automation and SAP Best Practices to refine authorizations. This service is designed to decrease effort and duration in managing roles and authorizations, enabling seamless cost management.

Driven by SAP AI Core automation, MOON AIRC precisely tailors authorizations to the necessary minimum, achieving substantial cost reductions and enhanced security. The service includes scoping, functional and organizational role definitions, and strategic role assignments—all aimed at minimizing license costs. Synchronization capabilities from SAP Signavio ensure a coherent approach to authorization management. In addition to optimizing license costs, this service delivers a high-quality, secure SAP Best Practice authorization concept.


Conclusion

The MOON services are at the forefront of license cost optimization, enabling companies to efficiently reduce authorizations to their necessary minimum. By focusing on precise authorization adjustments and employing automation, MOON Services empower organizations to achieve operational efficiency and substantial cost savings. Harness the potential of MOON Services and navigate your path to optimized license management and reduced overhead.

For more information about the offering send a mail to: security.consulting@sap.com

entry.title: Innovations in Master Data Governance with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Continuing the blog series about innovations in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), I'd like to share information about the key innovations in master data governance coming with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025.

Key Innovations include:

  • Continuous improvements in central governance (classic mode)​
  • Use of generative AI for governance processes (applies to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only, innovations in classic mode and in cloud-ready mode)​
  • Improvements in data quality management (classic mode and cloud-ready mode)
  • Revamped data provider integration for the provisioning of business-partner reference data​ (cloud-ready mode)
  • Application-agnostic legal hierarchies (business partner, cloud-ready mode)​

Key Innovations in Detail

Let me explain the innovations in more detail, according to the categories listed above. 

Continuous improvements in central governance (classic mode)​

This covers improvements in central governance of material, business partner, and financial data.

  • Material data:
    • Support for commodity codes comes integrated into the MDG UI as a separate User Interface Building Block (UIBB). Commodity codes from different numbering schemes can be assigned to a material and different valid from and to intervals can be maintained.
    • Input value help for characteristic (F4) now with assigned check table enables search either using the first 15 fields of the check table or Data Dictionary (DDIC) search help if it is assigned to the check table.
  • Financial data:
    • Inclusion of joint venture accounting fields as attributes of cost centers, profit centers, G/L accounts, and internal orders incl. validation checks and replication. 

      Use of joint venture accounting (JVA) fields as attributes of profit center
  • Propagation of changes done in an edition to the future edition to eliminate the need for repetitive updates across editions.

    Propagation of edition
  • Additionally, HANA-based search can be used as default search option.
  • Business partner data:
    • Enhanced client maintenance (de-central governance) scenarios depending on conditions such as create versus change scenarios, the actual client system sending the data, or the data to be processed.
    • Assignment of one or more data controllers and associated purpose to a business partner.
    • Enhanced IBAN converter (specifically for countries that require both an IBAN and a bank key) and alternative IBAN display format.
    • Document assignments on business partner level (create, change, or delete document assignments for business partners whether customer, supplier, or both in new Documents UIBB).
    • ​​Display of the validity of sales areas and purchasing organizations in the input help.
    • Entry of maintain payment reasons for customers or suppliers for general or company code data and maintenance of recipient types for Customer Extended Withholding Tax data.

Maintenance of payment reasons for customers or suppliers and maintenance of recipient type for customer extended withholding tax data

Use of generative AI for governance processes

On the one hand, this covers the use of embedded AI for additional entities in assisted changes and summary of changes in central governance (when using classic mode). In particular, the inclusion of flex entities in generative AI-assisted changes in the central governance of business partner, material, and custom objects, and the inclusion edition-based entities in AI-generated summary of changes in the central governance of business partner, finance, material and custom objects.​

On the other​, it is about the use of Joule copilot to govern business partner data and run spot-checks on MDG process status (when using cloud-ready mode):

  • ​Natural-language based prompts in Joule can be used to search, display, create, and change business partner data. 

Using Joule copilot for changing business partner data

  • Based on planned Joule content delivery, it is also planned to enable the search and display of specific information related to master data governance processes from November 2025 on.

Using Joule to search and display information about MDG processes

Improvements in data quality management (classic mode and cloud-ready mode)

There are various new features in the validation rules app for business partners and products. This includes capabilities to:

  • Copy validation rules
  • Create validation rules that check if a master data governance process has an attachment
  • Delete the validation rules' dependencies to other objects (for example, simulations, dimensions, or data quality evaluation runs) when deleting rules
  • Disable several validation rules at once
  • Filter for enabled usages, disabled usages and usages in general

Filtering validation rules for enabled usages

Revamped data provider integration for the provisioning of business-partner reference data​ (cloud-ready mode)

This enables integration with an external data provider of your choice for automated use of high-quality data in governance processes using SAP Cloud Integration​.  With SAP Cloud Integration, you can connect any data provider to the business-partner domain, leveraging high-quality compliant reference data for searching and creating business partners.

Data provider integration

  1. Enter search term to check if the required business partner is already there.

  2. As this is not the case, click "Go" to connect with data provider reference data.

  3. Select the appropriate entry and create business partner with auto-populated fields.

Individually created SAP Cloud Integration packages provide you with the capability to connect with the data provider API and map between the data provider data model and the SAP data model of business partner. 

With a pre-defined SAP Cloud Integration package, accessible from SAP Business Hub, you can integrate your SAP Master Data Governance application efficiently and with less effort with the data provider Corporate Data Quality (CDQ). This plug-and-play package ensures default mapping from the data provider specific data model to the SAP business partner data model.

Application-agnostic legal hierarchies (business partner, cloud-ready mode)​

This new app provides governance of an aligned, application-agnostic legal business partner hierarchy representing the company ownership.  With this app you can:

  • Create, display, and delete business partner hierarchies​​
  • Create, edit, and delete nodes​​
  • Search for existing business partner hierarchies and nodes​​
  • Assign a business partner to a node

This way you can achieve a single source of truth for legal ownership data across all applications and support for compliance with regulatory and audit requirements while being able to make faster decisions based on the easy creation and updates of ownership structures.

More information

See also the presentation outlining the MDG delta content coming with SAP S/4HANA 2025 Cloud Private Edition .

To get the full picture of planned innovations in SAP Master Data Governance across the entire MDG solution portfolio, see the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

To stay up to date, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance and join the Q&A and discussion forum.

entry.title: Sequential Processing of Allocation Cycles in Universal Allocation
entry.content:
This blog is part of our ongoing “how-to” series exploring Universal Allocation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. In this post, we’ll dive into the principles of sequential processing of allocation cycles during an allocation run.

Sequential Processing in Regular Allocation Cycles

For the purpose of this article, we’ll define the following allocation types as regular:

- Overhead Allocation
- Distribution
- Intercompany Allocation

When processing regular cycles within a single allocation run, an intermediary cache temporarily stores the results of each cycle. These results are then passed to subsequent cycles in the sequence.

Example

In this example, two cycles are processed sequentially within one allocation run, with an embedded dependency.

Cycle 1 (CC_SEQ1): Costs for building maintenance are allocated from the Building cost collector cost center to other cost centers (such as HR, IT, or Sales Management).


Cycle 2 (CC_SEQ2): Building maintenance and other costs are further reallocated from Sales Management to individual sales departments.

 

Using the Allocation Run app (or via Schedule Overhead Accounting Jobs), we select both cycles in the correct sequence and add them to the run worklist.

 

The application processes both cycles as part of a single allocation run.

In the Receivers tab of the result report, you can see that the receiver object from Cycle 1 becomes the sender in Cycle 2, confirming proper sequential processing.

 

Thanks to temporary data persistence between cycles, both CC_SEQ1 and CC_SEQ2 are processed within the same allocation run job. Initial costs are correctly reallocated through both steps in sequence to the final receivers.

Sequential Processing in Top-Down Distribution

With the introduction of Universal Allocation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the architecture of top-down distribution cycles has changed significantly. Compared to regular cycles, top-down distribution involves greater complexity and larger data volumes, which makes intermediary persistence within a single allocation run job not feasible.

Why it Matters

Sequential processing is highly valued by customers aiming to accelerate their period-end closing procedures. Without it, users have to wait for each individual cycle to finish before manually starting the next one.

Since intermediary caching is not possible due to data volume constraints, we introduced an alternative solution for top-down distribution.

How It Works

When running multiple top-down distribution cycles in a live run, a new control appears in the run dialog. This allows users to choose whether to process cycles sequentially, meaning that each cycle depends on the results of the previous one.

If sequential processing is selected, the system automatically splits the job into individual runs that are processed in sequence. The first cycle is processed, and once its results are posted to the Universal Journal (ACDOCA), the next cycle is triggered automatically—no manual intervention required.

Example

Let’s consider two top-down distribution cycles we want to process in a single run job with sequential processing:
- TDD_SEQ1: Distributes from Sales Organization to Customer Group level.
- TDD_SEQ2: Further distributes from Customer Group to individual Customer Detail level.

The user prepares a run worklist containing both cycles. Upon selecting the Live Run option, the system detects multiple top-down distribution cycles and presents the Sequential Processing option in the dialog.

 

When the user selects the Live Run option, the system detects multiple top-down distribution cycles and presents the Sequential Processing option in the dialog.

 

 Users can choose between two modes:
- Run sequentially but Stop on Error:  If any cycle ends with an error, processing stops. For example, if five cycles are in the worklist and Cycle 3 fails, then the processing of Cycles 4 and 5 is canceled. If the Situation Framework is enabled, the user is notified and can decide how to proceed.
- Run sequentially but Stop on Warning: If any cycle ends with a warning, processing stops. The user must decide how to continue.

In our example, the user selects Stop on Error. After initiating the run:
1. The first cycle is processed, and the first run appears in the Allocation Results app.
2. The second run job is automatically triggered after the first finishes, and the second cycle is processed.

The run report in Allocation Results shows that the initial run was split into two jobs, with data from TDD_SEQ1 used as input for TDD_SEQ2.

 

Summary

Sequential processing enables the handling of cycles with data dependencies. It is supported for both regular allocation cycles and top-down distribution cycles, though each uses a different method:
- Regular cycles use intermediary caching within a single run.
- Top-down distribution uses automatic job splitting and Universal Journal persistence.
This flexibility helps streamline allocation processes and supports faster, more efficient period-end closing.

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformation
entry.content:
Key Highlights

  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition 2025.
  • New Custom Code Migration capabilities accelerate the transformation of classic ERP code to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, including:
    • Documentation Chat - Get accurate answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications.
    • ABAP Program Explain - Understand the business purpose and logic of legacy code.
    • Explain for SAP S/4HANA Test Cockpit Issues - Diagnose and resolve S/4HANA-related Test Cockpit issues using context from simplification items and cookbooks.

Earlier this year, SAP introduced Joule for Developers — a set of embedded artificial intelligence capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP, that helps developers accelerate application and extension development, reduce costs, and boost productivity.

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, version 2025, providing comprehensive support for ABAP Cloud use cases. The release also introduces the first Custom Code Migration capabilities, bringing a powerful suite of AI-assisted capabilities purpose-built for ABAP development and cloud delivery.

Best of all, Joule for Developers remains free of charge, enabling customers and partners to integrate it into daily operations and accelerate innovation without commercial barriers.

 

What’s Included

This release for Private Cloud delivers AI-powered support for the core development scenarios ABAP developers rely on every day. Key capabilities include:

  • inline code completion,
  • ABAP/CDS code explanation,
  • automated unit test generation for ABAP and ABAP core data services (CDS),
  • RAP business objects generation,
  • RAP predictive business logic, and
  • OData consumption.

All capabilities are designed to accelerate development, improve code quality, and boost productivity from day one. Additionally, this release introduces the first wave of Custom Code Migration capabilities, designed to accelerate the move from classic SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Cloud Edition. These AI-powered features simplify code analysis and adaptation by:

  • Providing Documentation Chat for quick answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications:

 

  • Using ABAP Program Explain to clarify the business purpose and implementation logic of legacy code:

 

  • Explaining ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) findings with step-by-step guidance on how to fix the issues, based on simplification items and technical documentation:

 

All capabilities are designed to reduce manual effort, speed up migration projects, and help your teams to modernize their ABAP landscapes with great confidence.

The ABAP AI software development kit, powered by Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management, is now available and offers centralized access to the generative AI hub in SAP AI Core. It leverages the same robust platform SAP uses internally, delivering proven, production-grade infrastructure to customer landscapes. With simplified configuration and governance, development teams can adopt AI capabilities quickly, providing a significant boost to integration efforts.

 

Why This Matters

Private cloud customers require strict governance, security, and operational control - yet they also seek the speed and innovation modern AI-driven development delivers. This release addresses both priorities by enabling:

  • faster development cycles with AI-assisted coding and test generation,
  • stronger knowledge transfer through automated code explanations and copilot interactions,
  • higher delivery quality with automated testing and code migration support, and
  • secure innovation within controlled environments.

 

Looking Ahead

We’re building on this momentum with a series of targeted deliveries aligned to upcoming releases across the BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Planned updates for BTP ABAP Environment 2511, 2602, and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 include:

  • documentation generation capabilities,
  • enhanced explanations for reports in the Custom Code Migration application,
  • AI-enabled insights on Clean Core–related ATC findings directly within the Custom Code Migration application,
  • code migration and adaptation proposals to support developers working on RISE code adaptation,
  • ABAP CDS annotation and metadata extension generation, and
  • ABAP CDS analytical model generation.

These enhancements will extend Joule’s impact beyond code completion and test generation, supporting documentation, migration and Clean Core compliance, analytical use cases, and addressing more stages of the end-to-end development lifecycle.

 

Free Offer Extended

SAP Joule for Developers will remain free of charge. The extended promotion ensures that all customers and partners can continue to use Joule for Developers capabilities for free.

Access can be requested using the material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer now extends beyond the BTP ABAP environment and SAP Cloud ERP Public Edition to include SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition customers running the latest 2025 release.

 

Closing Remarks

SAP Joule for Developers’ delivery for Private Cloud is a significant milestone — combining end-to-end ABAP Cloud with AI use cases, innovative code migration scenarios, and a standardized ABAP AI SDK to bring practical AI assistance directly into everyday development workflows.

With extended free of charge access, we invite every customer and partner to explore SAP Joule for Developers, push its boundaries, and help shape the future of AI-assisted ABAP development.

Start using SAP Joule for Developers today and join us in building the next generation of intelligent, AI-driven ABAP innovation.

For a deeper dive, read the blog post by Simona Marincei, head of ABAP AI.

Learn more about SAP Joule for Developers capabilities here.

entry.title: 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑限制供应商发票的多次暂存
entry.content:
问题背景：

有客户提出需求，希望限制已暂存过账后的采购订单对应的收货参考凭证以及参考凭证项目重复暂存。如果一个采购订单已经完成收货，参考凭证，并且完成了发票的过账，希望不能再对这个采购订单进行发票暂存。

解决方案：

尝试通过自定义逻辑，使用一个 BAdI 来满足需求。

分析步骤：

1. 以前帮助处理过客户的关于开票的需求，我们需要用到的业务增强点都是一样的。可以参见这两篇 Blog ：在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑检查预制发票的付款条件与供应商主数据中的付款条件是否一致 | SAP Blogs 以及 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑限制未完成收货的采购订单开票丨SAP Blogs。

同时，正如我之前的文章里提到的，在 BAdI 给定的示例代码里，我们能发现有语句可以对触发 BAdI 的行为进行限制，根据我们的需要我们需要添加下面的语句限制 BAdI 仅在预制发票时触发，而不影响其他流程：

Park: if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Park ”

loop at ITEMSWITHPOREFERENCE REFERENCE INTO DATA(Supinvoice_item).
if action = if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Hold.

entry.title: From Customer Org. Chart to SAP Org. Structure
entry.content:
Hello SAP Gurus,
While diving deep into the world of SAP ERP for over 10 years, I wanted to share some of my findings and experience on a topic that can be a challenge for many of us: How to Design the Customer’s Organization Hierarchy into SAP Enterprise Structure.

It's great to deploy what the SAP best practice says, but from the customer perspective it’s very sensitive step as it’s reflecting the overall business decisions. I recognized this during my career in implementing SAP projects, and I hope my findings can help you out there for whom might be starting on a similar journey.

Bridging the Gap Between Customer's Org. Chart and SAP Enterprise Structure

We all have our company's organizational chart hanging somewhere in the office or in a PowerPoint file. It shows the customer's department hierarchy, who reports to whom, and how teams are structured.

But how do we take that familiar hierarchy and map it to SAP's world of Company Codes, Plants, and Purchasing Organizations? It's not always a one-to-one match, and that's where the complexity (and honestly, the fun!) begins.

I found an example of this in old SAP Community question from 2008. A community user laid out a detailed case study of a company with 4 factories, 3 regional distribution centers, 15 sales offices, in addition of an R&D team and project management team. It was a fantastic real world scenario that highlighted the tough question we often face.

"since material from Plant and RDC is being transferred to Branches and from there it is distributed to customers therefore the valuation of FG at BRANCH and RDC should be different as transportation cost, packing, unpacking etc cost should get added at Branch level. Therefore in case I make branch as Storage location, I will miss the valuation part while if I make them as Plant then there will be lot of documents get generated for each movement."

This is exactly the kind of practical dilemma that gets to the heart of enterprise structure design. It's a constant balancing act between financial accuracy and operational efficiency.

Understanding The SAP Organizational Units

Before we define and assign the SAP enterprise structure, we need to know exactly what of each SAP org. unit represents. It’s helpful to think of them in a hierarchical way, starting from the top.

  1. Client: the highest level in the SAP system hierarchy. Specifications that you make, or data that you enter at this level are valid for all company codes and for all other organizational structures. You therefore only need to make these specifications, or enter this data once. This ensures that the data is consistent.
  2. Company Codes: is the central organizational unit of external accounting within the SAP System. You must define at least one company code before implementing the Financial Accounting component. The business transactions relevant for Financial Accounting are entered, saved, and evaluated at company code level.
  3. Plant: organizational unit serving to subdivide an enterprise according to production, procurement, maintenance, and materials planning aspects. It is a place where either materials are produced or goods and services provided.
  4. Purchasing Organizations and Purchasing Groups: An organizational unit subdividing an enterprise according to the requirements of Purchasing. It procures materials and services, negotiates conditions of purchase with vendors, and is responsible for such transactions. A purchasing group is a key for a buyer or group of buyers in SAP ERP. It is responsible for the procurement of a material or class of materials, and is the principal channel for a company's dealings with its suppliers.

Organizational Unit

Key Characteristics

Typical Use Cases

Client

Highest level, represents entire corporate group

One per SAP system

Company Code

Legal entity with independent financial statements

Subsidiaries, country operations

Plant

Operational unit where business activities occur

Factories, warehouses, sales offices

Storage Location

Physical storage area within a Plant

Warehouse sections, storage areas

Purchasing Org

Defines procurement scope and authority

Centralized or decentralized procurement

Purchasing Group

Actual procurement team or buyer

Commodity teams, regional buyers

A Visual Approach to Mapping

I'm a visual learner, so diagrams really help me solidify these concepts. I've created a couple of diagrams to illustrate how a typical departmental structure might map to SAP organizational units, and how those units relate to each other.
Here's a conceptual mapping from real-world departments to SAP units:

And here's a more detailed example of what a complete SAP organizational hierarchy might looks like, incorporating multiple company codes, plants, and purchasing organizations:

My Key Takeaways and Learned Lessons

After implementing a lot of SAP projects, here are some advices I have heard from my leaders:

Start with the "Why," Not the "What." Don't just create organizational units because they exist in your company. Think about your business processes and reporting requirements first. What do the customer need to see in his financial reports? How he manage his inventory? How do he want to analyze his procurement activities and expenses? The answers to these questions should guide you WHAT is the correct design decisions.

  1. The Plant is probably the most versatile org. unit in SAP. I've seen Plants used to represent everything from manufacturing facilities to service centers. Don't be afraid to think creatively about how to use Plants to model your business operations. Just remember that each Plant needs to be assigned to a Company Code, so plan accordingly. And remember that SAP defines the plant as a logistics organizational element that is used by all the logistics modules. The plant is assigned to a company code that may have many plants assigned to it. A plant is typically configured in conjunction with the company code and valuation area due to tax rules and regulations.
    Depending on the role the plant has in the organization, a plant can be defined for the following purposes:
    • In Sales and Distribution (SD), a location from which finished goods and materials are stored and distributed.
    • A location from which services are rendered.
    • Materials Management (MM), a location where material flow is managed and stock requirements are managed from both the inbound and outbound perspectives.
    • A location where material stock is consumed, planned, and purchased.
    • A manufacturing facility where materials are produced, as in Production Planning (PP).
  2. Purchasing org. structure has a huge impact on your procurement processes, approval workflows, and reporting. I learned that the hard way when we had to redesign our purchasing structure because we hadn't thought through the implications properly. Take time to understand whether a centralized or decentralized org. unit makes the most sense for your company.
  3. Plan for Growth and Change, Your first design probably won't be perfect, and your business will expand over time. Build flexibility into your design where possible, and don't be afraid to iterate, I've seen too many implementations get stuck because they tried to create the "perfect" structure from day one instead of starting with something good and improving it over time.
  4. Document Your Decisions, This might seem obvious, but document not just what you designed, but why you designed it. think in future questions, when someone ask why the regional sales offices are defined as plants instead of storage locations, you'll be glad that you wrote your reasoning.

Important Considerations

in past implementations i've encountered some comments from the customer that might help you think through your own design:

  1. Multi-Country Operations: If the customer operates in multiple countries, you'll likely need separate company codes for each country due to legal and tax requirements, but you might be able to share plants across company codes for operational efficiency.
  2. Shared Transactions: If the customer has shared service centers (like a centralized IT department or shared warehouse), think carefully about how to define and assign these on SAP, sometimes they're best represented as separate org. units, sometimes as cost centers within existing org. units.
  3. Acquisitions and Divestitures: If the company invest in other legal entities by frequently acquires or divests business units, design the SAP structure to make these transitions easier, this might mean keeping acquired companies as separate company codes initially, even if the customer plan to integrate them later.

Summery

SAP Enterprise Structure design is a piece of art, a part of business administration science, and a part of overall company growth.
There's no one "correct" way to do it, but there are definitely wrong ways, the key here is to understand customer business requirements, think through the implications of your design, and be prepared to adapt as you may learn later.

I hope my thoughts and findings has been helpful for you, and I'm always learning new things about SAP organizational structures, so I'd love to hear your thoughts and experiences.

  • What challenges have you faced when mapping customer's organization in SAP?
  • What advice would you give to SAP community members or for a someone has just starting out?
  • Have you encountered any particularly creative or unusual organizational structure designs?

SAP ERP SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Material Documents Overview (F1077): Enhancing Features and Usability
entry.content:
Hello SAP users! Let's talk about some updates to the Material Documents Overview app (F1077) and new features designed to close the gaps between the older WebGUI application MB51 and the newer app. We want to thank everyone who shared their experience with the app—it really helps us make things better for you. The following updates are only relevant for the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. 

Closing Functional Gaps and Enhancing User Experience

SAP is not only working on closing the gaps between MB51 and the Material Documents Overview app but is also enhancing the user experience. The new app is designed to offer a smoother, more intuitive experience that makes it worthwhile to switch. Keep in mind that transitioning to this new app is essential, as the old app will eventually be deprecated.

FAQs Based on Your Feedback

We've gathered some frequently asked questions from customer feedback and are happy to answer them here:

Q: How can I add and arrange more columns and filter options?

A: Click the “Settings” icon at the top of the list report table. Under “Columns,” enter your search term, like “special stock type.” Check the boxes for the columns you want to add, then click “OK.” You can drag and drop to arrange columns as you like.

Q: How can I sort the list report?

A: Click the “Settings” icon at the top of the list report table. Then click “Sort” and pick how you want to sort the data, like by Plant, Storage Location, Material, or Batch. You can save your changes as a variant under "My views," and share it with others if you want.

Q: How can I see values such as Value in local Currency or the Signed quantity?

A: You either select the variant Material Document List with Values or click on setting and add the filter Value in local Currency and or Signed Quantity.

Q: How can I find or create a variant?

A: Select the dropdown menu for “Select View” in the top left corner next to the Standard view – choose a predelivered variant to see a different set of fields e. g. “Material Document List with Values”.

To create your own variant, add the filters that you want to the list view by clicking on the settings icon for the table. Select your filters and choose OK. If you want, you can also change the sequence of the columns by dragging and dropping them into place. When you have the columns arranged how you wish, click on the dropdown menu arrow for 'Select View' next to Standard and select Save As. Give your variant view a name and choose Save.

Q: Where can I find the Document Header Text or Reference field?

The Document Header Text field can be selected via the settings. The Reference field is called Delivery Note in the new app, and you can also find it via the settings. Both fields are available on the material document's detail page under the "General Information" section.

Q: Where can I see the complete set of information for a stock transfer including the issuing and receiving party?

A: In your filter bar, select filter "Include Auto-Created Item (Transfer)" and set it to "yes". You will then see two line entries. Alternatively, you can display all transfer related attributes in one line by selecting the according fields labelled with “transfer” in the settings menu.

Q: How can I separate material code and description in Excel downloads?

A: Use the “Export” icon and choose “Export as.” Then select your format and destination. Make sure to check the “Split cells with multiple values” box before you click “Export.” Your Excel file will then have separate columns for material descriptions and codes.

Wrap-Up

We’re focused on not only making the Material Documents Overview app better by addressing functional gaps but also improving the overall user experience. Your input is really important in helping us improve, and making the switch to the new app will ensure you're ready for when the old app is phased out.

Keep an eye on the official roadmap for more updates, and let us know your thoughts in the comments. Feel free to reach out with any questions. Thanks for being a part of this journey!

Interested in more information on Inventory Management? Check out the following resource https://www.sap-press.com/inventory-management-with-sap-s4hana_6141/

entry.title: Migrate Your SAP Landscape Onto Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

i wanna to share with you today a dilemma topics regarding SAP migration onto the Cloud. The question today isn't if you should move your SAP landscape to the cloud or not, but HOW? to do it strategically and efficiently.

Your SAP system is the backbone of your business; your finance, your supply chain, your core data. Moving it is a journey that requires expertise, precision, strong methodology and partnership.

Migration Approaches

The 6Rs migration strategy helps you understand and prioritize portfolio and application discovery, planning, change management, and the technical processes involved in migrating your SAP system to the cloud. The 6 Rs represent six strategies listed in the following table that help you plan for your application migrations.

R strategy

Methodology

Rehosting

The application is migrated as is to AWS. This is also called a "lift-and-shift" approach.

Re-platforming

The application is changed or transformed in some aspect as part of its migration to AWS.

Repurchasing

You move to a different application or solution on the cloud.

Refactoring / Re‑architecting

The application is redesigned (for example, it’s converted from a monolithic architecture to microservices) as part of the migration to AWS.

Retiring

The application is retired during migration to AWS.

Retaining

The application isn’t migrated.

The decision tree diagram helps you visualize the end-to-end process, starting from application discovery and moving through each 6 R strategy.

 The three strategies that are specifically applicable for SAP migrations to cloud are Rehosting, Re-platforming and Re-Architect.

  • Rehosting is applicable when you want to move your SAP system AS-IS to the cloud hosting. This type of migration involves minimal change and can be seen as a natural fit for customers who are already running some sort of SAP systems.
  • Re-platforming is applicable when you want to migrate from an anyDB source database (such as IBM DB2, Oracle Database, or SQL Server) to an SAP HANA database.
  • Re-Architect (or Transform) This is the most transformative path. This includes two major scenarios:
    • Greenfield: A clean slate implementation of S/4HANA directly on cloud hosting. This is for complete process redesign.
    • Brownfield: Where you upgrade your existing SAP ECC system to S/4HANA while migrating it to AWS. This keeps your historical data and existing business processes, but modernized.

The Business Imperative Beyond Infrastructure

So why are thousands of companies migrating their mission-critical SAP systems to the cloud? It goes far beyond simply replacing a data center. It's about achieving four core business outcomes:

  1. Cost & TCO Reduction: By shifting to the cloud offerings like pay-as-you-go model, you eliminate the crippling cycle of hardware refreshes. You can easily right-size environments, utilize reserved instances for deep discounts, and drastically reduce your Total Cost of Ownership.
  2. Agility & Innovation: This is where the magic happens. Moving SAP onto cloud gives you immediate access to other cloud services like AI, Machine Learning, IoT, and Advanced Analytics. This allows you to rapidly innovate on top of your core SAP data in ways that were impossible on-premise.
  3. Performance & Scalability: cloud hosting usually offers the largest, most powerful certified instances for SAP ERP. This means faster reports, quicker transaction processing, and the ability to instantly scale up for month-end closes or peak demand periods, and then scale back down to save cost.
  4. Security & Resilience: all cloud hosting providers, provides a foundational security layer that is unparalleled, and our architecture ensures high availability, disaster recovery, and compliance, giving your teams peace of mind.

End-to-End Migration From Strategy to Success

 The methodology is a robust, four-phase framework; Assess, Mobilize, Migrate, and Optimize, it's designed to de-risk your entire journey.

  1. Assess: We begin with a deep dive. A discovery workshop, a complete inventory of your SAP landscape, and defining non-functional requirements like Recovery Point Objectives/Recovery Time Objectives. The goal is to produce a precise, tailored architecture and cost model. Conduct transfer knowledge sessions with internal team to be able to operate the SAP landscape on the cloud.
  2. Mobilize: This is the planning and preparation stage. We conduct technical validation, create a detailed migration plan, execute all prerequisites checks, and importantly, on-board and upskill your teams, ensuring a smooth transition of ownership post-migration.
  3. Migrate: The execution phase. We utilize best-in-class tools and zero-downtime techniques where possible, ensuring business continuity throughout the process.
  4. Optimize: This is continuous value realization. We move from just running SAP to reducing cost through rightsizing, minimizing future risk, and increasing organizational agility by leveraging cloud services.

The benefits are clear: Reduce TCO, Minimize Risk, Increase Agility, and Innovate. We measure our success not by the project completion date, but by the realization of these benefits in your business.

Targeted Business Outcomes of Migrating SAP to Cloud

 This figure shows the full scope of business outcomes you can achieve once your core SAP systems are modernized on the cloud. Think of your SAP data flowing seamlessly into the cloud, unlocking potential in every direction:

  • Cost Reduction & Data Center Retirement: The immediate, tangible saving by eliminating technical debt and shifting from CaPx to OpEx.
  • Performance & Auto-scaling: Dramatically faster operations and environments that automatically adjust to workload, guaranteeing peak performance during critical business cycles.
  • Agility and Staff Productivity: By offloading infrastructure management to our managed services, your highly skilled IT staff can dedicate their time to high-value projects, not maintenance.
  • Digital Transformation (SAP S/4HANA): This infrastructure is the perfect foundation for a future S/4HANA transformation, leveraging the speed of HANA and the elasticity of cloud hosting.
  • Data and Analytics: The critical ability to integrate your SAP data with the vast array of cloud analytical tools like SAC, Amazon Redshift or MS PowerBI, to gain deep, competitive business insights and complex data science applications.
  • Improved Security and Resilience: A globally secure and highly available platform that meets stringent compliance requirements.
  • Industry Solutions: With SAP migration onto cloud, you will not just benefit from cloud hosting or cloud services only; but you will gain the benefit of utilize a lot of business solution that leverage your business operations and streamline your business applications platform and all are running onto cloud and integrates together to leverage your business performance and efficiency.

Hope my thoughts useful for you and guide you to the right decision 👍

thank you all and wish you a smooth and successful migration.

entry.title: Financial Planned Data in Professional Services – by Project Financial Booklet
entry.content:
In this blog post we will explain how the plan categories are used in the customer project scenario tailored for professional services. We will also explain how the plan data is calculated and updated in ACDOCP, and how they can be reported with the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app.

enjoy

Chenchu Zhong and Stefan Walz

In customer project management, staying on top of budgets and costs is essential for ensuring profitability and meeting client expectations, especially in fixed-price billing scenarios. Multiple planning versions help monitor the original plan and track changes that arise from resource allocation or scope adjustments. Additionally, we use the financial plan data for the POC calculation in Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR). In the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app, we have enabled the display of all planned data versions for customer projects, ensuring full visibility and transparency. In this blog post, we’ll explain what each plan category means, and which is updated in ACDOCP. We will explain the calculations and applications of planned data in the project-based services scenario, including Baseline Planned Data (PRO01), Ongoing Planned Data (PRO02), EAC Planned Data (PRO03), EBRR Planned Data (REVREC01), Manual Plan Category, and Virtual Plan Category.

Let’s use a fixed-price customer project as our example, where multiple planning data versions may be available to track and manage costs.

Baseline Planned Data

CPM Baseline planned data (Plan category PRO01) represents a snapshot of the initial project plan that records the contract conditions under which the project was started.

This version is technically created when the project moves to the “In Execution” stage.

Ongoing Planned Data

CPM Ongoing planned data (Plan category PRO02) reflects the current planning adjustment of the project. During the execution phase, project managers can update planned resources and expenses using the Plan Customer Projects app, which then updates the ongoing planned data. To ensure the ongoing planned data is reflected in financials, it is important to select “Sync with Finance” under the “Version” tab.

In the project example, the baseline planned data matches the ongoing planned data (referred to as “current”), as no changes have been made to the ongoing planned version.

Figure 1 Manual ACDOCP update of baseline planned data and ongoing planned data in the Plan Customer Projects app

By choosing “Sync with Finance”, the ongoing planned data is updated in financials (ACDOCP). In the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app, both the baseline planned data, and ongoing planned data can be viewed.

Figure 2 Display baseline planned data and ongoing planned data in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app

The service cost rate is maintained by the overhead accountant in the Manage Cost Rate – Services app. The cost rates are determined for each resource plan item by the company code/ service org, the role/activity type, work item, or PERNR if assigned.

The time planning is done based on role/activity type. The hours are distributed by the system over the months the project is running. This distribution can be adjusted manually. The system derives the cost rate for each planning period and calculates the amount by multiplied hours of the period with the cost rate of the period.

The plan data in the customer project application are always shown in the project currency. If there is an own project currency applied for the project which deviates from the company code currency, or if there are cost rates maintained in a different currency because intercompany resources are planned, there is a currency conversion done with a monthly P rate occurs by default. However, you can change the currency conversion type in the configuration of the plan category.

The plan revenue is determined in the fixed price project by the billing plan amount.

CPM application sends the data to ACDOCP with transaction currency = project currency. If there is a conversion required, at least for group currency, then ACDOCP converts with a monthly P rate (default configuration in plan categories)

EAC Planned Data

CPM EAC planned data (plan category PRO03), is an estimated total cost of a project on completion, combining actual costs incurred to date with forecasts for remaining effort and expenditures.

While baseline and ongoing plan only take the resource planning into account, the EAC calculation considers deviations between actual and plan.

  • Key Components:
    • Actual Costs (AC): What has been spent so far (read from ACDOCA)
    • Estimate to Completion (ETC): Projected costs to complete tasks still in progress.
    • Estimate at Completion (EAC): Actual Costs (AC) + Estimate to Completion (ETC).
  • Calculation:
    • Actual Costs (AC) = read from ACDOA, no calculation
    • Estimate to Completion (ETC)

The ETC calculation works the following:

  1. First planned costs in project currency are calculated:
    The planned quantity per period is multiplied with the cost rate per period.
    If the cost rate currency is different to the project currency, the currency conversion is done with P rate, which is valid at the beginning of the period.
  2. Then calculate the ETC cost based on customer project data as follows:
    (Planned Hours-Actual Hours) / Planned Hours × Planned Cost in Project Currency
  3. Remark: this is done for each expense type

The actuals are read from ACDOCA. To get plan costs in project currency, the object currency is read.

See https://me.sap.com/notes/3547953/E for details on how ETC and EAC calculation works.

The calculated EAC will be different to the original CPM plan, if the following occurs:

  1. You record more than the total planned hours allocated for the planned activity type/role (This applies regardless of who logged the hours, as along as they belong to the planned activity type)
  2. Hours are logged under an unplanned/unassigned activity type/role, work item, or service organization
  3. Post unplanned expenses, e.g., travel expenses

In the Review Customer Projects app, the project manager can adjust the ETC values based on forecasted efforts (quantities) required to complete the project.

For the example project, the junior consultant has already recorded 5 hours of work, resulting in actual costs of 5 hours multiplied by the service cost rate of 50 EUR/h, equating to 250 EUR. The ETC quantity for the junior consultant is currently 5 hours based on the current plan.

Figure 3 Review EAC values in the app Review Customer Projects

However, the project manager reassesses the situation and determines that the 5 hours allocated for the junior consultant are insufficient to finish the remaining task. As a result, the project manager updates the ETC for the junior consultant from 5 hours to 8 hours. With the updated ETC, the EAC quantity for the junior consultant increases from 10 hours to 13 hours, resulting in the EAC costs increasing from 500 EUR to 650 EUR.

Figure 4 Adjust EAC values in the app “Review Customer Projects”

To update the EAC values in Financials (ACDOCP), the project manager uses the Transfer Project Forecast app to schedule a recurring job to update the EAC values for ongoing projects.

Remark on the planned revenue: their calculation is done dependent on the contract type. For a fixed price project plan revenue is taken from billing plan. In the case of T&E billing, billing simulation is carried out to determine the planned revenues based on the EAC costs.

Figure 5 Transfer Project Forecast to Finance

The job has been successfully executed for the example project. The updated forecasting data can now be reviewed in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app.

Figure 6 Display EAC planned data in the app Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services

For customer projects, the planned data (baseline, ongoing, EAC, EBRR) is consistently updated within the leading ledger. Consequently, in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Service app, the planned data can be viewed by selecting the leading ledger in the global filter.

The plan category PRO03 serves as the source for the planned data related to the revenue recognition key SPTMSR for the T&E billing &PoC-based revenue recognition method. Please refer to the blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/customer-projects-with-t-amp-e-billing-amp-poc-based-revenue-recognition/ba-p/13771327 for more details.

EBRR Planned Data

EBRR planned data (plan category REVREC01) represents the planned/EAC data/, which was used in Event-Based Revenue Recognition period-end calculation. When you run period-end close or you use the EBRR monitor app and save the revalued data, this plan category is updated with the used plan amounts for the selected period.

While the 3 plan categories shown above have always only one amount (as previous plan updates are deleted with a new plan update) the EBRR plan data is  kept per period. This allows you to analyze which EAC data was used for a previous period-end calculation.

In this example, the project uses the revenue recognition key SPFC, which applies the fixed-price, cost-based percentage-of-completion (POC) method. In the configuration activity Maintain Settings for Event-Based Revenue Recognition (ID 102530), the planned data source is set to strategy 306.

This means that Event-based EBRR uses EAC data only if there was an update in the Review Customer Project app (confirmed EAC), otherwise the current CPM plan data are read, and no ACDOCP entries are used.

At period-end EBRR uses the dynamic EAC by simulating the functionality of the Review Customer Project app. In which cases dynamic EAC can differ to original CPM plan see above. If there was an update in the Review Customer Project app, this is taken.

Figure 7 Source for Plan Values in the Configuration Activity Maintain Settings for Event-Based Revenue Recognition (ID 102530)

According to the configuration, in this example the real-time event-based revenue recognition is calculated using the confirmed EAC from the CPM planning applications (1150 EUR). Selecting “Revalue” recalculates the recognized revenue based on the dynamic EAC costs—which in this example equals the confirmed EAC—and is 1300 EUR.

Figure 8 Revalue in the Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects app

Additionally, the first revaluation creates an EBRR planned data snapshot (plan category REVREC01). This snapshot is updated at each revaluation / period-end closing to capture the latest dynamic EAC for period-end closing calculations. The planned data is updated in the Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects app.

Figure 9 EBRR Planned Data in the Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects app

The EBRR planned data is now visible in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app as . During the revaluation or period-end closing, EBRR posts the delta of the EAC to the corresponding period of the revaluation/period-end close. In the Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects app, the aggregated value is always displayed. In the Project Financial Booklet, you can choose to view data up to the current period or leave the periods unselected to see the aggregated EBRR planned data.

Figure 10 Display EBRR Planned Data in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app

Manual Planned Data

The plan categories above are calculated by the system based on the resource planning and billing information. With 2502 you can create an own plan category for projects. The manual planned data is characterized by the fact that it is recorded based on cost elements without reference to resource planning. They can be recorded in the SAP S/4HANA system by the Import Financial Plan Data app, through API or by transfer from SAC.

The manual plan category can we created in configuration activity (ID 101970)

Figure 11 Configuration for manual plan category

Usage 4 allows a manual planning.

With the assignment of application type “Project Management”, the following additional checks and derivation logic are provided during the update in ACDOCP:

  • A WBS element must be provided for every planning line item. This prevents an accidental deletion of planned data provided for other projects, which can happen when you use a periodic plan category like PLN.
  • The account assignment type “WBS element” is determined for all planning line items. This leads to subsequent derivation of additional attributes from the project and the assigned sales order item. For example, the profit center from the WBS billing element and the margin analysis fields from the sales order item are derived and stored for the planning line items.

Recommendation: use for your manual planning an own plan category with application type “project management” , and not a periodic plan category like PLN.

When you use the import app, you must provide a CSV File, which you can see here:

Figure 12 File for plan data import

The columns with the X in line 3 define the plan data scope: these fields must be filled, otherwise you get an error, and the plan data cannot be updated. Additional this is the scope, which is checked for project plan categories: if an X is missing, the import is rejected.

 You can define the fiscal year and period, and you can select company code or transaction currency. The currencies that are not provided, including global currency and object currency, are determined and translated by the ACDCOP update. The exchange rate type is defined in the plan category (see above) and the currency date is the first of the entered period.

For a project in a foreign currency,  you can enter the plan data in a transaction currency that is equal to the project currency.

 When using plan data in EBRR you need at least one revenue and one expense/cost G/L account line item. In the configuration activity Maintain Settings for Event-Based Revenue Recognition, you can set this custom plan category as the source of planned values for EBRR processing (source 500) for the allowed cost-based POC revenue recognition keys.

In the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app, use the page filter to select your custom planning category, then add the measures Planned Revenue Manual, Planned Cost Manual, and Planned Margin Manual to display the externally imported planned data for customer projects.

Figure 13 Display Imported Planned Data in the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app

Virtual Plan Category

For aggregation of the amount of several plan categories you can use a virtual plan category

Figure 14 Configuration for virtual plan category

There is an own application type “8 Virtual plan category” available.

In configuration you can assign the plan categories to the virtual plan category (config ID 106876)

Figure 15 Configuration for assigning plan categories to virtual plan category

Please note there are no ACDOCP entries for the virtual plan category! You can enter the virtual plan category in the reporting as plan category: the report will read all assigned plan categories and aggregate the values. Additional you can assign the virtual plan category in EBRR as source for plan.

The virtual plan category could help you to move from periodic plan category PLN to a manual project plan category.

Conclusion

 Understanding and effectively monitoring planned data across various plan categories is essential for driving successful customer projects. In this blog, we have outlined the definitions, calculations, and currency conversions for key plan categories, including Baseline Planned Data (PRO01), Ongoing Planned Data (PRO02), EAC Planned Data (PRO03), EBRR Planned Data (REVREC01), Manual Plan Category, and Virtual Plan Category. By leveraging the Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services app, you can gain enhanced visibility across planning versions, enabling better budget control, profitability tracking, and alignment of plans with actuals.

entry.title: 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑在101收货时将物料批次号自动设置为固定值
entry.content:
问题背景：

有客户提出需求，由于业务限制，希望在采购订单101收货时将批次号统一设置为物料号后八位，方便管理。

解决方案：

尝试通过自定义逻辑，使用一个 BAdI 来满足需求。

分析步骤：

1. 基于当前的业务描述，我们首先需要确认有哪些 BAdI 增强点支持当前需求。增强点 LOBM_AFTER_BATCH_NUMBER_INT ，根据文档描述，该增强点可以用于在内部批次号分配后创建一个新批次号并使用。但同时，这个 BAdI 的限制是对同一物料如果已经存在和新的批次号一样的批次号，则会返回错误。所以这个 BAdI 只能帮我们实现一部分需求，且我们需要添加逻辑防止重复创建。

2. 继续分析。增强点 MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA 可以用于在不同业务流程中修改收货单据的抬头、行项目数据，增强点 MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA 可以用于更改不同流程的货物移动的文档项目字段中的数据。这两个增强点都可以满足我们的需求，但是前者只适用于 Post Goods Movement for Purchase Order 。所以我们配合后者，就可以满足在 MIGO 中的应用。

3. 我们现在已经找到了所有满足当前需求的增强点，现在，我们需要找到合适的 CDS Views ，提供所有我们需要的字段数据。CDS View I_Batch 存储了物料及相关的批次号，所以我们可以借助这个 CDS Views 来做条件判断。

4. 那接下来就是完成 BAdI 的逻辑。首先是利用 LOBM_AFTER_BATCH_NUMBER_INT 来解决需要创建批次号的情况。需要添加逻辑判断，只有在 I_Batch 里对应物料没有相同批次号的情况下才生效。

DATA: lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch.
DATA: lv_batchnum TYPE string.
lv_new_batch = substring( val = batch_allocation-material
                                off = 10
                                len = 8 ).
IF batch_allocation-materialtype = 'ZROH'.
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @batch_allocation-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      batch_out = lv_new_batch..
  ENDIF.
ENDIF.

5. 接下来是批次号对当前物料已经创建，我们只需要修改的情况。先实现 MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA 的逻辑。同样我们需要使用到 I_Batch 来做判断。

 DATA: lv_batch TYPE string,
       lv_material TYPE string, 
       lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch,
       lv_batchnum TYPE string.
 LOOP AT gr4xy_item INTO DATA(ls_item).
  lv_new_batch = substring( val = ls_item-material
                               off = 10
                               len = 8 ).
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @LS_item-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    lv_material = ls_item-material.
    IF ls_item-sourceofgr = 'PURORD'.
      lv_batch = substring( val = lv_material
      off = 10
      len = 8 ).
      LOOP AT change_item ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_change_item>).
        IF <fs_change_item>-deliverydocumentitem = ls_item-deliverydocumentitem.
          <fs_change_item>-batch = lv_batch.
          EXIT. 
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
 ENDLOOP.

6. 最后就是 MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA 的逻辑。实现后，我们就可以完成在 MIGO 里的逻辑。

DATA: lv_batch TYPE string,  " Define a variable to temporarily hold the batch.
      lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch,
      lv_batchnum TYPE string.
IF invtrymgmtcallingappl EQ me->if_mmim_item_provide_data~gc_calling_application_migo."'MIGO'.    "for MIGO as calling appliction
  lv_new_batch = substring( val = item-material
                              off = 10
                              len = 8 ).
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @item-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc = 0.
      change_item-batch = lv_new_batch.
  ENDIF.
ENDIF.

7. 测试后，上述代码可以满足需求。

结语：

通过阅读本文以及之前写过的几篇相似场景的 Blog ，希望您已知晓在做采购订单101收货时，如何通过自定义逻辑来将物料批次号自动设置为固定值。
关注以下链接可以看到更多有关 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 采购相关的问题：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

您也可以通过后面的链接阅读更多有关 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 采购的博文：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

如果您对本文有任何的建议和想法，欢迎在评论区提出，期待与您一起交流。也欢迎您关注我的个人账号，期待我们在下一篇博文再见！
